description: High-level design language and component guidelines to replicate the reference dashboard look and feel.
design_principles: Prioritize clarity and calm: low-noise surfaces, generous whitespace, and limited color accents.
Drive focus with hierarchy: bold dark headings, mid-tone body text, soft backgrounds, and strong brand accents used sparingly.
Leverage soft geometry: large rounded rectangles, circular avatars, and pill-shaped controls for a friendly but premium feel.
Maintain visual consistency: 8px spacing grid, consistent radii, and repeatable card structures across all modules.
Signal interactivity clearly: subtle elevation, brand-colored strokes, hover shadows, and clear iconography for clickable elements.
Optimize for dashboards: medium information density with strong grouping into sections and cards, each with a single primary KPI or task.

layout.grid_system: 12-column layout for desktop with fixed-width left sidebar and fluid content area.
layout.content_structure: Left vertical navigation, right main workspace composed of horizontal bands (Live + Search, Courses, Progress + Popular content).

usage.card_padding: Use 24px internal padding for primary cards; 16px for compact list items and controls.
usage.section_padding: Use 32px from page edge to content blocks and 32px vertical spacing between major sections.
usage.element_spacing: Use 8–16px spacing between related elements inside cards (title → subtitle → meta → controls).

usage.app_shell: Apply 32px–40px outer radius to the main white container inside the gradient background (can be treated as 2xl+).
usage.cards: Use 24px radius on all primary cards (courses, progress, popular lectures).
usage.inputs_and_buttons: Use 999px pill radius for search fields, buttons, chips, and avatar outlines.
usage.side_nav: Use 12–16px radius for the active nav indicator pill.

shadows_and_blur.frosted_effect: Use subtle inner gradients and very light blur-style gradients on course cards and progress cards to create a soft, semi-glass appearance. Avoid hard borders; rely on light shadows and gradients.

usage.page_titles: Use 24px–32px bold (h1/display) for section headers like 'My courses', 'My progress', and 'Popular lectures'.
usage.card_titles: Use 16px–18px semi-bold for card titles (course names, widgets headings).
usage.body_copy: Use 14px regular for descriptions, labels, and metadata.
usage.meta_text: Use 12px for supporting info (timestamps, durations, counts).
usage.alignment: Left-align all content; reserve center alignment for charts or single KPI numbers.

iconography.style: Outlined, 1.5px–2px stroke weight, rounded corners, matching brand blue and neutral gray palette.

usage.sidebar: Use 20px outlined icons to the left of each nav label.
usage.controls: Use 16px icons inside circular or pill buttons (play, dropdown arrows, chevrons).

app_shell.description: Primary desktop canvas housing the LMS experience.
app_shell.structure: Full-viewport gradient background with a centered white shell. Inside the shell, use a fixed-width left sidebar and fluid right content column.

sidebar_navigation.description: Vertical navigation rail on the left holding logo, nav items, and user profile.
sections: Logo and product name at the top.
Primary nav items stacked with equal spacing.
Current user mini-profile anchored at the bottom.

nav_item.layout: Horizontal row: icon on the left, label on the right.
nav_item.spacing: 12px between icon and label; 12px vertical padding; 16px left-right padding.
nav_item.default_state: Text in neutral gray (#5F6473), icon in matching neutral, transparent background.
nav_item.active_state: Label in brand primary, icon in brand primary, pill indicator bar or rounded capsule with brand blue and a subtle glow.

logo_lockup.layout: Circular brand mark on the left with product name text on the right.
logo_lockup.treatment: Use brand primary for the mark and type; keep it light and minimal.

header_band_top.description: Top band with 'Live broadcasts' avatar rail on the left and 'Search course' on the right.

layout.orientation: Two-column horizontal layout: left block ~55%, right block ~45%.
layout.alignment: Vertically center-aligned within the band with 24px vertical padding.

avatar_chip.description: Circular avatar with dual-ring highlight used for live broadcasts and user listing.

states.default: Outer ring in brand primary with inner white ring and avatar photo inside.
states.active: Increase outer ring thickness and add a very subtle shadow.
states.inactive: Gray or soft neutral ring with lower opacity.

avatar_chip.spacing: 8px between avatar chips in a horizontal rail.

chip_button.description: Pill-shaped secondary button such as 'More' near live broadcasts.
chip_button.default_state: Soft neutral background (#F3F5FF), text in #304DB5 or #5F6473.
chip_button.hover_state: Slightly darker background and subtle shadow.
chip_button.usage: Secondary actions that complement primary CTAs but are less prominent.

search_bar.description: Hero search for courses at the top-right.
search_bar.structure: Label 'Search course' above a pill input field with a CTA button on the right.

input_field.icon: Left-aligned search icon inside the input, 16px.

primary_button.label: Search
primary_button.hover_state: Slightly brighter gradient and stronger shadow.
primary_button.focus_state: Add 2px soft outer glow in primary_light.

search_bar.spacing: 16px horizontal gap between text field and button.

section_header.description: Reusable pattern for rows like 'My courses', 'My progress', and 'Popular lectures'.
section_header.layout: Left-aligned title, optional right-aligned link action such as 'View all'.
section_header.spacing: 16px below the header before the content block.

course_card.description: Primary visual unit representing a course within 'My courses'.

container.width: Fixed width for carousel-like row; consistent height across cards.

content_structure: Course title at the top left.
Short course description below the title.
Progress bar at the bottom spanning most of the card width.
Compact chevron icon on the right side to indicate navigation.

add_course_card.description: Minimal card at the end of the course carousel used to add a new course.
add_course_card.content: Vertical stack: outlined plus icon and 'Add' label in brand primary.

summary_widget_progress.description: Card under 'My progress' showing total hours and donut chart.

container.layout: Two-column internal grid: left circular chart, right stats and dropdown.

header_row.left_label: Widget title such as 'Total hours spent' (14px medium).
header_row.right_control: Compact pill dropdown with current period label and caret icon.

donut_chart.rings: Use 3–4 concentric rings in different pastel blues/purples.
donut_chart.inner_label: Numeric KPI in center (e.g., 134) in 24px bold.
donut_chart.stroke_caps: Rounded stroke ends for a soft look.

stat_stack.items: Each stat line: bold primary number (e.g., 75/115) and small label below (e.g., Visited lectures).

list_card_media.description: Horizontally oriented media cards for 'Popular lectures'.

container.layout: Horizontal flex: avatar thumbnail, text stack, trailing play button.

avatar.shape: Rounded rectangle or circle with 12–16px radius.

text_block.title: 14px medium in text_primary.
text_block.meta: 12px regular in text_muted (time duration and icons).

play_button.shadow: Soft drop shadow to signal clickability.
play_button.hover_state: Slight increase in background brightness and a subtle scale-up.

list_card_media.stacking: Arrange 3–4 list_card_media vertically with 12–16px gap between cards.

dropdown_pill.description: Compact dropdown used for date ranges (e.g., June 2020).

footer_profile.description: User profile summary anchored at the bottom-left of the sidebar.
footer_profile.layout: Avatar on the left, text stack (name + role) on the right.
footer_profile.spacing: 8px between avatar and text stack; 16px padding around the block.

scroll_behavior.description: Ensure scroll only appears on the main content when necessary.
guidelines: Sidebar should remain fixed; only the right content column scrolls.
Sections maintain generous top and bottom padding so cards never touch shell edges.
Avoid visible scrollbars on individual cards; use full-page scroll for simplicity.

interaction_states.focus: Apply a 2px soft outline in primary_soft or primary_light for keyboard focus on inputs and buttons.
interaction_states.hover: Increase elevation slightly, brighten backgrounds, and adjust icon/text color subtly toward brand primary.
interaction_states.active: Slightly darken the button or card background and compress the shadow to indicate press state.
interaction_states.disabled: Reduce opacity to ~40% and remove shadows.
